cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 240 miles SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the central Gulf toward the southeast Louisiana coast, then expected to slow and turn north and northeast inland over Mississippi and toward the Tennessee Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast (near Houma–Grand Isle area)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River, MS to the AL/FL border (includes Mobile Bay) for TS winds; Storm Surge Warning east of Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA to the AL/FL border including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph, gusts 50 mph) possible Sunday night into Monday; low (7 %) chance of sustained 50-kt (58 mph) winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible in and around Mobile Bay under the Storm Surge Warning.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rainfall possible Monday–Tuesday with a risk of flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Sunday–Monday; dangerous surf and rip currents along the Alabama coast.
